content: floral magic crochet pattern by ashley maglich/your craft gremlin this pattern is for your personal use do not share any portions of this pattern in any form for others to use you are 100% free to sell any physical items made with this pattern please feel free to tag me @ashleymaglich or link to the pattern in any posts or mentions of thank you so much for your support i look forward to seeing what you create ©ashleymaglich abbreviations us terms ● mc - magic_ring ● chain - chain ● single_crochet - single_crochet ● double_crochet - double_crochet ● fo - fasten_off ● slip_stitch - slip stich materials yarn crochet hook *in tutorial i used 2mm* scissors darning needle - to sew in ends *for tutorial purposes i am using a 2mm crochet hook & worsted weight yarn with this pattern you can use any hook size & coordinating yarn *i change colors every round except the last however please take creative liberty this is a great project for all that scrap yarn you got lying around round 1 mc ch2 *doesn t count* 20 double_crochet into the mc slip_stitch to 1st double_crochet & fo *pull center closed* ©ashleymaglich round 2 in any stitch ch3 *does count as a double_crochet* double_crochet nxt stitch ch2 double_crochet nxt2 ch2 repeat all the way around slip_stitch to top of ch3 & fo ©ashleymaglich round 3 in any ch2 space ch3 *counts as double_crochet* double_crochet ch2 2dc in that same space 2dc ch2 2dc in every ch2 space around slip_stitch into the top of the ch3 *you can change colors for the last round but i tend to keep it the same if you are changing just fo & add your new color for this tutorial i am keeping the same color from the previous round ©ashleymaglich round 4 ch1 single_crochet in space between double_crochet corner clusters in ch2 space make 7dc single_crochet in the space between double_crochet corner clusters & repeat all the way around slip_stitch into 1st single_crochet & fo ©ashleymaglich ©ashleymaglich your flower is now complete these have so much potential coasters earbud pouch change purse *if lined curtains a blanket table runner appliques for clothes jeans or bags earrings if you use embroidery thread wind spinner dangles coasters… i hope you enjoyed this pattern head on over to my youtube channel for video tutorials of my patterns as well as other craft things ©ashleymaglich
